properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 9:58PM PST until January 17 at 4:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions. Total
snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with localized amounts up
to 6 inches, are expected. There will also be areas of
southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph which will
cause blowing and drifting of snow.

* WHERE...San Bernardino County mountain areas above 5500 feet.

* WHEN...6 PM Thursday to 4 AM Friday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at
times in fog and blowing snow.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered
roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.

For road condition information in California...enter
8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or
9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET
